responses: Qwiklabs provides real cloud environments that help developers and IT professionals learn cloud platforms and software, such as Firebase, Kubernetes and get hands-on experience.

responses: We’re only considering your progress from 27th September 2021 to 27th October 2021. Only the progress done in this month will be counted towards goodies. If you’ve started the tracks last year, we ask you to register with a new email ID if you want to receive the Qwiklabs credits and the cool goodies. This is because only your work from 27th September 2021 to 27th October 2021 will be counted towards your progress for this program.

Completing at least one track successfully between 27th September 2021 to 27th October 2021 will get you goodies and digital badges! 
We highly encourage you to utilise your Qwiklabs credits to the fullest and complete both the tracks for bonus goodies!

patterns: I am not able to get the Qwiklabs credits after enrolling in the program, what to do?
I didn’t get my Qwiklabs credits
i did not get gcp credits
i dont know where my credits are
i registered and did not get my credits
i followed the steps and didnt get credits
why did i not get any credits
i dont have any gcp credits
i have issues with my credits
i have problems with my qwiklabs credits
i have issues with getting my qwiklabs credits
i am finding it difficult to get my qwiklabs credits
responses:
If you haven't gotten your Qwiklabs credits, try the following solutions:
1. https://youtu.be/NtpOozyucdA - Here is a helpful video created by one of our facilitators that will tell you how to get the credits.
2. If you have just completed the lab, then please wait for a few minutes and refresh your chrome browser tab a few times.
3. Start the lab again, wait for 5 minutes and end the lab and then check again.
4. Reach out to your Facilitator and they will help you here.
5. Reach out to the Qwiklabs Chat support via the Qwiklabs home page. (You will need to click on the help button "?" alongside your profile icon on the top right corner when logged-in in order to access chat support)
6. Just drop an email to dscsupport@qwiklabs.com.

patterns: I am stuck! I need help with Qwiklabs, what should I do?
I have a problem with Qwiklabs.
I have an issue with Qwiklabs.
I’m facing a bug with Qwiklabs
responses:
If you're facing problems with Qwiklabs, here a few ways you can get unstuck:
1. Reach out to your Facilitators.
2. Just reach out to the Qwiklabs chat support or drop them an email at dscsupport@qwiklabs.com

patterns: Why is my Qwiklabs account blocked and how to get it unblocked?
i think my account is blocked
responses:
If you try to use the resources which are not intended to be used in the lab the account will get blocked. See our official support article https://support.google.com/qwiklabs/answer/9157984?hl=en to get more clarity on why this happened.
Here are a few examples which may lead to use resource out of the lab scope:

1. Creating an extra VM instance than the set limit for maximum number of instances you can launch in the Cloud Console for the lab.
2. Creating more number of nodes which are not intended to be created for the lab in the Cloud Console for the lab
3. Specifying extra number of cores in the machine types with higher computing power.
4. Running different commands which may lead to launch of extra resources other than the lab scope.
The above mentioned are a few examples which can get your account blocked, if you are doing anything similar, mentioned in the above examples your account can get blocked as a result of those actions as well. Please reach out to dscsupport@qwiklabs.com to get it unblocked.

patterns: Why does my Qwiklabs page show a red banner with "Quota Expired"?"
Why is Qwiklabs showing a red banner?
how can i correct quota expired
what should i do quota expired
responses: As part of the credits pass, you have 5 attempts for each lab in the program. If you try a lab more than 5 times, then your quota gets expired. To reset your quota, please reach out to dscsupport@qwiklabs.com.

patterns: How to take a lab on Qwiklabs?
i didnt understand how labs work
responses: Just see the video tutorial here to get started -  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cyp7soKLOYI

patterns: can you clarify what a quest is
what is a quest in qwiklabs
responses: A quest is a learning path that contains a number of hands-on labs. Complete a quest to earn a badge. Qwiklabs Quests are learning paths that consist of a collection of labs organized by technologies, specific cloud services, and practical use cases. Quests range from introductory to advanced level.

patterns: what can i do with badge
tell me more about digital badges
responses: Skill badges are exclusive digital Google Cloud badges that demonstrate your growing Google Cloud recognized skillset. You can earn them by completing skill badge quests on Qwiklabs.Once you earn all the badges belonging to a track, you'll be eligible for goodies. You can also share them on your social media profiles.To learn more about skill badges, visit https://cloud.google.com/training/badges.

patterns: How to share badges on Social media?
What can I do with the badges?
how to show my badges to others
how to add badges in my resume
how to add badges in linkedin
can i share skill badges in instagram
what should i do with badges
i got badges, what can i do now
after getting badges what should i do?
what can i do with badges
what things can i do with badges
what should i do with my digital badges
responses:
Your badges are easily shareable!
1. Make your profile public.
2. Right-click View Public Profile and select copy link address.
3. Create links on your social media pages or resume.
Tip: On LinkedIn, add your badge as a certification.

responses: Just reach out to the Facilitator and she will cross-check, help you get the instructions and enrol you in the program.

patterns: Can I get an introduction of the program?
what is 30 days of google cloud program
responses: 30 Days of Google Cloud program will provide you an opportunity to kickstart your career in cloud and get hands-on practice on Google Cloud Platform - the tool that powers apps like Google Search, Gmail and YouTube. This program is completely free and you’ll get super cool goodies on successful completion!

patterns: What do I need to be a part of this?
What should I prepare for this?
what do i need to know
what should i do to be ready
responses:
You need to have access to a working internet connection & a laptop with the latest Chrome browser. 
You need to be above the age of 18
You need to be a student of JSSSTU.
No prerequisites required!

patterns: What is the syllabus for the event?
what tracks will i be learning
what will i learn in gcp
responses: You will have the choice to pursue two tracks - Cloud Engineering Track and Data Science & Machine Learning Track. For more details, check out this page. https://events.withgoogle.com/30daysofgooglecloud/program-syllabus/#content

patterns: What’s the point of doing this program?
What will I get from this program?
what will i get out of this
how will this help my career
what are the perks of gcp
what are the benefits of gcp
what is the point of gcp
responses:
30 Days of Google Cloud program will provide you an opportunity to kickstart your career in the cloud. Along the way, you will learn & practice concepts like computing, application development, big data & machine learning using cloud. If you get stuck, you will have your Campus Facilitators to help.
The skills and badges you gain from the program can be a game-changer for your career, like it has for so many seniors in SJCE!

responses: The credits are valid for a period of 6 months. Once you have completed both tracks, please feel free to use them on any other labs you find interesting.

patterns: I still have questions, whom should I reach out to?
responses:
If your query didn't get resolved, please reach out to your campus facilitator Poorvi.
 You can also join our Discord Community Server to join fellow participants and get your doubts clarified! https://discord.dscjssstu.in/
 For more detailed FAQs, please check the guide in our Instragram bio (@gdscjssstu).
